name: DeepMind
summary: We're committed to solving intelligence, to advance science and benefit humanity.
description:
We’re a team of scientists, engineers, machine learning experts and more, working together to advance the state of the art in artificial intelligence. We use our technologies for widespread public benefit and scientific discovery, and collaborate with others on critical challenges, ensuring safety and ethics are the highest priority.

Our long term aim is to solve intelligence, developing more general and capable problem-solving systems, known as artificial general intelligence (AGI). 

Guided by safety and ethics, this invention could help society find answers to some of the world’s most pressing and fundamental scientific challenges.
 
We have a track record of breakthroughs in fundamental AI research, published in journals like Nature, Science, and more.Our programs have learned to diagnose eye diseases as effectively as the world’s top doctors, to save 30% of the energy used to keep data centres cool, and to predict the complex 3D shapes of proteins - which could one day transform how drugs are invented.
type: شركة يملكها عدد قليل من الأشخاص

posts.text:
As AI becomes part of our everyday lives, how do we make sure it aligns with human values? 💭

In PNAS News, we draw inspiration from philosophy to understand how to choose AI principles in a world with diverse opinions and beliefs.

Find out more: https://lnkd.in/eXcRveSM

Today, we’re delighted to announce that DeepMind and the Brain team from Google Research will join forces to become a new unit: 𝗚𝗼𝗼𝗴𝗹𝗲 𝗗𝗲𝗲𝗽𝗠𝗶𝗻𝗱

By bringing together the best talent, computing power, infrastructure and resources, we’ll continue accelerating progress towards a world where AI can help solve the biggest challenges facing humanity. 

Find out more → https://lnkd.in/emEhbBvn

Our CEO Demis Hassabis speaks to CBS News 60 Minutes on how we’re working with Google to drive more AI breakthroughs in a bold and responsible way.

Millions of scientists are already using the artificial intelligence system #AlphaFold to tackle biology's biggest challenges. 🧬

Watch the full story: https://dpmd.ai/41sQHeY

🎙️ Calling fans of DeepMind: The Podcast!

We’re proud to be nominated in this year’s The Webby Awards, which honor excellence on the Internet.

You can help us win People’s Voice in 2️⃣ categories: Science & Education and Technology. 

📣 Vote now: https://dpmd.ai/43pxgpn #Webbys

What could a world with artificial general intelligence look like? 🤔

We collaborated with students at Central Saint Martins, University of The Arts London on a new exhibition exploring how emerging technologies could help us tackle global challenges.

🗓️ 11-20 April
📍 Lethaby Gallery, London
🔗 Find out more: https://lnkd.in/evPGWrNq

Congratulations to research scientist Yannis Assael for being included in MIT Technology Review’s Innovators Under 35 list in Europe!

He has been recognised for his important contributions to AI, which range from working on audio-visual speech recognition to Ithaca, the first neural network to help restore missing text in damaged ancient texts.

Find out more: https://dpmd.ai/3Ml20BW

Looking for a specific moment in a YouTube video? Our AI technology will help you get there faster. ⏩

Over 80 million videos now have auto-generated chapters, making it easier to jump to the part you’re most interested in.

Find out more: https://dpmd.ai/3KzbE2A

Congratulations to Demis Hassabis and John Jumper on receiving the 2023 Canada Gairdner International Award for the development of the AI system #AlphaFold.

Over 1 million researchers have now accessed the database to help accelerate scientific progress. 🧬

“Now you can look up a 3D structure of a protein almost as easily as doing a keyword Google search,” says Hassabis. “It is science at digital speed.”

The Gairdner Awards honours international excellence in fundamental research impacting human health.

This is a huge achievement for Demis, John and the entire #AlphaFold team. Find out more: https://dpmd.ai/3ntHggX

We recently released a code update to #AlphaFold 2. 🧬

The AI system has been trained on new data to produce better results for larger proteins and protein complexes.

We hope this helps researchers make more progress in areas from drug design to sustainability: https://lnkd.in/eRhKArwN

Seven years ago, #AlphaGo made history by becoming the first AI to defeat a world champion in the game of Go. ⚫⚪

Since then, its successor MuZero has mastered a range of complex games, including chess, shogi and Atari - without being told the rules.

The ideas behind these powerful learning and planning algorithms are already being used to tackle real-world problems.

Find out how: https://dpmd.ai/muzero
